column4: Hello? I have a problem with the resolution selection dialogue.
Have you checked for any hardware drivers? (System->Administration->Hardware Drivers)
It says I don't need any (if I clicked in the right place).
What is the problem with the Resolution Dialog?
I don't have any options besides 640x480. I am using a very old version of ubuntu and I want to also get actualizations, but I have another problem with that.
What resolution is your monitor?
1024x768, but it used to run fine with 1280x760 in Windows.
Hmm.. I used to have that problem but usually it was a Driver that wasn't installed.
Do you think getting a driver from my motherboard for Linux coudl solve the problem?
I don't really think so, I am not an expert on this by any means but I think it would be a problem with the graphics card, not the motherboard
My graphic card is onboard.
Oh, then yes you could try.
Or try running update manager and see if that works
I tried, and wish I could get some updates, but I get errors there too.
What kind of errors>
It says I the repository might no longer be available. It starts downloading a list of files, but every and each of them fails.
Try running 'sudo apt-get update' in terminal (without the quotes of course)
Loads of errors and nothing downloaded. I think it's happening because I tries to download from the br.archive.ubuntu.com server, hence my system language.
That might be it, though I am sorry but I do not know much more about your situation.
Is there anyway to switch my update server?
Yes! I just found something, go to system > administration > software sources, and click Download From, and choose other and go to United States and find one there
duffydack, guntbert: Thank you all, actually. A lot.
